meanings.definition: To plan and direct the route or course of a ship, aircraft, or other form of transportation.
meanings.sent1: The captain will navigate the ship safely through the storm.
meanings.sent2: She used a map to navigate her way through the forest.
meanings.sent3: Trying to navigate a busy airport can be quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully navigated the complex world of online shopping.
meanings.sent5: He had to navigate the treacherous waters to reach the island.

meanings.definition: To move through or over an area or place, especially carefully or with difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The hiker had to navigate the rocky terrain to reach the summit.
meanings.sent2: The cat carefully navigated its way across the narrow ledge.
meanings.sent3: Trying to navigate a crowded room with a tray of drinks can be tricky.
meanings.sent4: She navigated the narrow alleyways of the old town like a pro.
meanings.sent5: He skillfully navigated the obstacle course during the competition.

meanings.definition: To find one's way or travel through a place.
meanings.sent1: The lost hiker had to navigate back to the main trail.
meanings.sent2: She navigated through the bustling city streets to find the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: Trying to navigate a corn maze can be a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: She navigated her way through the dense fog using only a compass.
meanings.sent5: He confidently navigated the unfamiliar city with ease.
